intro: Freyera cynapioides, commonly known as the Canary Island cress, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found in rocky soils. Freyera cynapioides is also known for its ability to tolerate saline conditions, making it a hardy species in Mediterranean climates.
